story.text: (Adds background)Bogota Jan 2 (Reuters) - Colombia's public external debt rose to $25.14 billion in September, or 18.8 percent of gross domestic product, versus $23.45 billion in the same month the year before, the central bank said in a statement on Tuesday. The country's economy grew by a stronger-than-expected 7.68 percent in the third quarter, thanks in part to increased public and private investment. The government says growth for full 2006 was probably about 6 percent. Total external debt was $39.57 billion in September, up from $37.46 billion in September 2005. Colombia's balance of payments deficit rose to $1.96 billion in September compared with $1.58 billion in September of 2005, a separate statement from the bank said. Remittances from Colombians working abroad rose about 20 percent in September to $2.85 billion from $2.39 billion in September 2005.
story.title: update 1 - colombian external debt $ 25 . 14 bln in sept - cenbank
